filmography.title: Count Three and Pray
filmography.role_description: A wild, orphan backwoods girl who is taken in by a reformed Civil War soldier; Woodward's film debut.
filmography.plot: A Civil War soldier returns home to the South to rebuild the town church and his life, but his past reputation causes trouble.

filmography.title: A Kiss Before Dying
filmography.role_description: A wealthy heiress who investigates the mysterious death of her sister, suspecting her charming new boyfriend.
filmography.plot: A ruthlessly ambitious college student murders his pregnant girlfriend and then targets her sister to secure her family's fortune.

filmography.title: The Three Faces of Eve
filmography.role_description: A tour-de-force performance playing a timid housewife suffering from multiple personality disorder; the role that won her the Oscar.
filmography.plot: A doctor treats a timid housewife who suffers from dissociative identity disorder, manifesting three distinct personalities.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: No Down Payment
filmography.role_description: A frustrated, uneducated wife in a new suburban development who yearns for a better life.
filmography.plot: The lives of four couples living in a new California housing development intersect, revealing ambition, racism, and marital strife.

filmography.title: The Long, Hot Summer
filmography.role_description: The intelligent, strong-willed daughter of a powerful town boss who resists her father's attempts to marry her off.
filmography.plot: A con man arrives in a small Southern town and becomes involved with the wealthy, domineering owner of the town.

filmography.title: Rally 'Round the Flag, Boys!
filmography.role_description: A civic-minded suburban housewife whose neglect of her husband leads to comedic complications.
filmography.plot: A suburban husband is tempted by a neighbor while his wife is busy organizing a protest against a local missile base.

filmography.title: The Sound and the Fury
filmography.role_description: A rebellious young woman in a decaying Southern family who longs to escape her suffocating home life.
filmography.plot: The decline of the Compson family in the Deep South, focusing on the struggles of the brothers and their niece.

filmography.title: The Fugitive Kind
filmography.role_description: A wild, alcoholic bohemian who competes with an older woman for the affections of a drifter.
filmography.plot: A drifter arrives in a small Southern town and becomes involved with an older woman trapped in a loveless marriage.

filmography.title: From the Terrace
filmography.role_description: The unfaithful, socially ambitious wife of a driven Wall Street executive.
filmography.plot: A man returns from WWII driven to succeed in business, but his ambition costs him his happiness and marriage.

filmography.title: Paris Blues
filmography.role_description: An American tourist in Paris who falls for a jazz musician (Paul Newman) and tries to convince him to return to the US.
filmography.plot: Two jazz musicians in Paris deal with romantic problems and their careers.

filmography.title: The Stripper
filmography.role_description: An aging showgirl who returns to her small hometown and becomes involved with a younger man.
filmography.plot: A washed-up showgirl stays with old friends and starts a romance with their teenage son.

filmography.title: A New Kind of Love
filmography.role_description: A tomboyish fashion copycat in Paris who undergoes a makeover to win the heart of a journalist.
filmography.plot: A fashion copycat and a journalist meet in Paris and fall in love, assuming different identities.

filmography.title: A Big Hand for the Little Lady
filmography.role_description: A homesteader wife who has to take over her husband's hand in a high-stakes poker game.
filmography.plot: A naive couple gets involved in a high-stakes poker game in the Old West, leading to an unexpected twist.

filmography.title: A Fine Madness
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering, supportive wife of a rebellious, womanizing poet played by Sean Connery.
filmography.plot: A brilliant but unstable poet is coerced into seeing a psychiatrist by his wife, leading to chaos.

filmography.title: Rachel, Rachel
filmography.role_description: A shy, 35-year-old schoolteacher living with her mother who experiences a sexual awakening and emotional growth.
filmography.plot: A lonely schoolteacher tries to break out of her shell and find love in a small town.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: Winning
filmography.role_description: A single mother who marries a race car driver, but their marriage is strained by his career obsession.
filmography.plot: A race car driver puts his career ahead of his wife and stepson, risking his marriage.

filmography.title: WUSA
filmography.role_description: A down-on-her-luck drifter who gets involved with a cynical radio announcer in New Orleans.
filmography.plot: A radio announcer at a right-wing station in New Orleans becomes involved in a political conspiracy.

filmography.title: They Might Be Giants
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist who becomes fascinated by a patient who believes he is Sherlock Holmes, eventually becoming his 'Watson'.
filmography.plot: A wealthy judge who thinks he is Sherlock Holmes is treated by a female psychiatrist named Dr. Watson.

filmography.title: The Effect of Gamma Rays on Man-in-the-Moon Marigolds
filmography.role_description: An embittered, eccentric widow who stifles her two daughters while dreaming of a better life.
filmography.plot: A single mother with a bleak outlook on life raises her two daughters, one of whom finds solace in science experiments.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress

filmography.title: Summer Wishes, Winter Dreams
filmography.role_description: A middle-aged New York housewife who undergoes an emotional crisis and re-evaluates her life after her mother's death.
filmography.plot: A woman faces a mid-life crisis, dealing with her distant husband, her mother's death, and memories of a past love.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: The Drowning Pool
filmography.role_description: A wealthy oil heiress who hires private investigator Lew Harper to find out who is blackmailing her.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper travels to Louisiana to help an old flame who is being blackmailed.

filmography.title: Sybil
filmography.role_description: The dedicated psychiatrist who treats a young woman with multiple personality disorder in this landmark TV movie.
filmography.plot: A young woman suffering from dissociative identity disorder undergoes treatment to uncover the trauma of her childhood.

filmography.title: Harry & Son
filmography.role_description: A warm, supportive friend to a widower (Paul Newman) struggling to connect with his son.
filmography.plot: A construction worker who loses his job tries to relate to his artistic son who wants to be a writer.

filmography.title: Do You Remember Love
filmography.role_description: A college professor and poet who struggles with the onset of Alzheimer's disease.
filmography.plot: A brilliant professor begins to succumb to Alzheimer's, affecting her work and her relationship with her family.
filmography.awards: Emmy Award: Win – Outstanding Lead Actress (Miniseries/Movie)

filmography.title: The Glass Menagerie
filmography.role_description: The faded Southern belle mother who obsessively tries to secure a suitor for her shy, disabled daughter.
filmography.plot: A son tries to support his mother and crippled sister in St. Louis during the Depression.
filmography.awards: Independent Spirit Award: Nomination – Best Female Lead

filmography.title: Mr. & Mrs. Bridge
filmography.role_description: A conservative, repressed housewife in 1930s Kansas City trying to maintain appearances in a changing world.
filmography.plot: The story of a traditional family living in Kansas City during the 1930s and 40s, and the changes that drift them apart.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; NYFCC: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Philadelphia
filmography.role_description: The loving and supportive mother of a gay lawyer dying of AIDS; a small but poignant role.
filmography.plot: When a man with HIV is fired by his law firm because of his condition, he hires a homophobic small time lawyer as the only willing advocate for a wrongful dismissal suit.

filmography.title: Empire Falls
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, manipulative matriarch who owns most of a decaying Maine town; Woodward's final screen role.
filmography.plot: The manager of the Empire Grill diner in a blue-collar Maine town tries to cope with his bossy boss, his creative daughter, and his father.
filmography.awards: Emmy & Golden Globe Nomination: Best Supporting Actress
